definition: to pay a New Year call/to wish sb a Happy New Year
to pay respect/worship/visit/salute
surname Nian
year/CL:個|个[ge4]
Beware of suspicious folk bearing gifts, they are sure to be ill-intentioned. (idiom)
pinyin: huang2 shu3 lang2 gei3 ji1 bai4 nian2

definition: see 黃鼠狼給雞拜年|黄鼠狼给鸡拜年[huang2 shu3 lang2 gei3 ji1 bai4 nian2]
pinyin: huang2 shu3 lang2 gei3 ji1 bai4 nian2 , mei2 an1 hao3 xin1
containing_words.word: 黃鼠狼給雞拜年，沒安好心

sentences.english: After that, people call on their relatives, friends and neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 在那之後，人們給親戚，朋友和鄰居拜年。

sentences.english: I'll pay a New Year call to my uncle today.
sentences.chinese: 今天我要去叔叔家拜年。

sentences.english: Visiting relatives is still considered a major event on the first day of the first Lunar month.
sentences.chinese: 延續自大年夜，拜年依然是大年初一的重要活動。

sentences.english: Mr. Cheng greets our audience for the Chinese New Year and talks about the local Chinese garment industry.
sentences.chinese: 鄭時甘先生與聽衆朋友拜年及講到紐約的車衣行業。

sentences.english: In this episode, we had invited Leung Suet Lin (P. 6) and Chan Sze Ting (S. 2) to greet us for the new year.
sentences.chinese: 今集請到梁雪蓮同學和陳思婷同學向大家拜年。

sentences.english: New Year Spring Festival in honor of the guests were first under the Chicken Noodle bowl of cake to the guests to eat.
sentences.chinese: 春節款待拜年客人均要先下一碗餈粑雞湯麪給客人喫。

sentences.english: Have you prepared any New Year's gifts?
sentences.chinese: 拜年要帶的伴手禮你準備好了嗎？

sentences.english: That year, I was four years old, with uncle and brother to go to pay a new year call Hanchuan home.
sentences.chinese: 那一年，我四歲，隨二叔和哥哥一同去漢川老家拜年。

sentences.english: On the second day of the New Year, Chin and her motherarrived.
sentences.chinese: 舊曆正月初二日琴跟着她的母親來拜年。

sentences.english: Now do you know how to say greetings in Cantonese?
sentences.chinese: 現在你應該知道怎麼用粵語拜年了吧？

sentences.english: Pilgrimage after the New Year give grandparents and uncles.
sentences.chinese: 進香過後，就給祖父母及叔叔們拜年。

sentences.english: Visit families (especially those older than yourself) and friends to pass on your good wishes for the New Year.
sentences.chinese: 去長輩和朋友家，給他們拜年。

sentences.english: Don't greet people who are in mourning.
sentences.chinese: 不要向服喪期的人們問候拜年。

sentences.english: He has to visit his uncle at Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 在春節期間，他必須去給他的舅舅拜年。

sentences.english: Yes, and put up couplets, send best wishes for the New Year, eat dumplings and set off firecrackers.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，還要貼春聯兒，拜年，喫餃子，放鞭炮呢。

sentences.english: I sent greetings to my friends via SMS messages, which only cost me some 20 yuan.
sentences.chinese: 我通過短信拜年，而這隻花費我20幾元而已。

definition: to pay respects during a festival
to visit relatives
to celebrate the Chinese New Year
at the Chinese New Year or other festivities
(of a family) to come together at lunar New Year's Eve/family reunion at New Year's
last day of the lunar year/Chinese New Year's Eve
to call on sb/to drop in/to visit sb's home
to celebrate a festival/after the celebrations (i.e. once the festival is over)
last day of the lunar year/Chinese New Year's Eve
to visit one's friends and relatives
to offer birthday congratulations (to an elderly person)
May you have a prosperous New Year! (New Year's greeting)
lunar New Year's Eve
to offer sacrifices to one's ancestors
Spring Festival (Chinese New Year)
to give a present
